summary: Confucius Institutes offer Chinese language instruction, cultural events, and more at about 100 U.S. universities. Because the Chinese government funds these institutes, some researchers, U.S. officials, and others have raised concerns about undue influence and suppression of academic freedom. We reviewed 10 universities and found their institute directors were all U.S. university employees who reported they—not China—had full control. Some held events on controversial topics...
title: China: Agreements Establishing Confucius Institutes at U.S. Universities Are Similar, but Institute Operations Vary
